item.title: What percentage of Indians are vegetarian?
item.description: Approximately 30-40% of the population in India is estimated to follow a vegetarian diet. However, this percentage can vary depending on the region, cultural practices, and religious beliefs. Why Indians Follow Vegetarianism: Religious Beliefs: Hinduism: Many Hindus follow a vegetarian diet as part of their religious beliefs, which promote compassion and non-violence (ahimsa). item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Few relationship events in life, those change people's personality?
item.description: Relationship events can indeed have a significant impact on a person's personality, shaping their behaviors, attitudes, and emotional responses. These events can occur at any stage of a relationship, from the initial stages of courtship to long-term commitment.
